intro: Glossopetalon, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive golden-yellow floral display. Glossopetalon is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its ecological importance includes providing nectar for native pollinators and supporting local biodiversity.
